content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Everything is fine now.

The discription states that, in the case of one DNF, the worst result is removed. But in your test and solution, you remove the best result instead. Which one is intended?

I find the implementation more logical than the description, because your result with a DNF in the last round should not be better than a result with an instead really, really bad last round.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Very interesting topic and good difficulty level. Not too hard but one needs to read carefully. Will be really interesting in shortest mode ! Great job.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: The user who is trying to solve this contribution will need to think deeper than just averaging out the times, which is the goal of CoC. Even though this problem isn't incredibly hard, it will still take some thinking to complete.

I'm not sure but I think you should change the Goal by changing lowest to either highest or worst based on the solution you provided. Also typo therefore is missing an "e".
I didn't modify it because I'm not sure if the entire second paragraph should be modified.
here is what I think should be written:


DNFs are always considered worse than any actual time. So if there is only one DNF in a set of 5 solves, both that solve and the lowest/best time result are removed. Therefore the highest/worst time is actually part of the final 3 times.
But if there are 2 or more DNFs, the entire average is considered a DNF.

Goal
* Please change "digits after the decimal point" to "decimal places".

* I don't understand the note: why would 0.105 be rounded to 0.10 instead of 0.11?

Input
* Please add "(floats with 2 decimal places or {{DNF}})" after "times".

Output
* Please remove the quotation marks.

Constraints
* Please delete the constraint.

Stub generator
* Line 1: Suggest to change "read time:string(100)" to "loopline 5 time:string(10)".

Thanks.
Thanks for your feedback, I'll get right on it

Yeah I did initially think that it would be simpler to just consider a DNF the worst time period. But A) the way the problem is written now is actually how they calculate the average in competitions, and I want to stay loyal to that, and B) it adds a little extra challenge that requires some extra thinking, which just makes it better. 
Yes, I know I probably didn't do the best job explaining the requirements in the problem, I'll see if I can change the wording a bit to make it easier to understand.
Thanks for your feedback! Much appreciated

Yes, you are right. oopsie
In the case of 1 DNF that time and the best time are meant to be removed. I've changed the statement to be correct
Also I tried the change the comment in the solution from "removing worst time" to "removing best time" but its not submitting, so feel free to just ignore that comment. All the actual code should still be correct
